intro: Zanthoxylum rigidum subsp. hasslerianum, commonly known as the Hassler's prickly ash, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swamps and bottomlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
